name: "Preacher" - Season 1: "South Will Rise Again" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: The opening of the episode is a flashback to an old west town.
questions.explanation:
True.

	An unnamed man rides into a town called Ratwater on a horse. They slowly saunter into town, his face nearly blotted out by the sun.  The man walks into the general store and hands the clerk a note. The clerk promises to have it all by the next morning.

questions.text: The as-yet unnamed old man bought a bottle of what type of alcohol for $5 at the tavern?
questions.explanation:
Whiskey.

	This was also during the flashback scene at the beginning of the episode. The show open with a nearly 10 minute segment set about 100 years in the past. After the man walked into the bar, he tried to rent a room for the night, but they didn't have any "sleeping" rooms, only "whore" rooms. The room he got came with a $5 bottle of whiskey.

questions.text: What physical deformity does Eugene have?
options: Large patches of discolored skin all over his body
questions.explanation:
A malformed mouth.

	Eugene is credited as "arseface" in the show's credits when he appears in an episode. Eugene had been shot in the face to cause the physical deformity.  The effect is done with prosthetic makeup rather than digitally.

questions.text: Who did Cassidy declare his love for?
questions.explanation:
Tulip.

	Tulip found out his secret in the previous episode, and brought him to her uncle's house to stay the night. After a discussion the next morning, Cassidy declared he had "fallen" for her. At this point he didn't yet know that Tulip and Jesse were former lovers.

questions.text: Who was it Tulip spent two years attempting to track down to exact her revenge?
questions.explanation:
Carlos.

	She explained to Cassidy that Carlos had taken everything from her and her boyfriend. She then explained in detail how she had spent two years tracking Carlos down and now that she knew where he was, her boyfriend was refusing to go with her to exact revenge.

questions.text: What were Fiore and DeBlanc practicing in the hotel bathroom?
options: How to put on makeup for disguises.
How to hide in a confined space.
questions.explanation:
How to answer a phone.

	The phone, which was a direct line to "up there" had been ringing since the end of the previous episode. They were practicing how to answer the phone, and what to say while they were on it.

Donnie.

	Donnie, the man who had several previous run-ins with Jesse Custer, returned to work only to find that his boss had been converted by the Preacher. Donnie, still recovering from a broken arm, was very upset that his boss was now on the side of the lord and with Jesse. He started screaming at his boss in front or Mayor Person.

options: Slang term for the local whorehouse
questions.explanation:
Restaurant.

	The Flavor Station was pretty much the only restaurant in Anneville, at least the only one shown in the first five episodes. Jesse would meet with Emily, as she was a waitress there, when not volunteering at the church.

questions.text: Who was the only person who would openly speak about Jesse's power?
questions.explanation:
Donnie.

	Donnie confessed to his wife about what had happened in the bathroom stall several episodes earlier. By the end of the story he was crying on her shoulder. Other than Donnie, very few people noticed that Jesse had a power over others, they appeared to just accept everything at face value. Those that did notice, didn't speak about it openly.

questions.text: Who did Fiore and DeBlanc meet with at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Jesse.

	The two had been talking with Cassidy over the past several episodes, though they got tired of waiting on him to deliver. Instead they had the sheriff introduce them to Jesse as men "from the government". They started to explain what the source of his power was, but the scene shifted before they finished.
